author: Elastic
attributes.description: Iodine is a tool for tunneling Internet protocol version 4 (IPV4) traffic over the DNS protocol to circumvent firewalls, network security groups, and network access lists while evading detection.
false_positives: Normal use of Iodine is uncommon apart from security testing and research. Use by non-security engineers is very uncommon.
attributes.name: Deprecated - Potential DNS Tunneling via Iodine
attributes.note: This rule was deprecated due to its addition to the umbrella `Potential Linux Tunneling and/or Port Forwarding` (6ee947e9-de7e-4281-a55d-09289bdf947e) rule.
attributes.query: event.category:process and host.os.type:linux and event.type:(start or process_started) and process.name:(iodine or iodined)
